main event: On 17 April 1958, witnesses observed a brilliant white or pinkish object in the sky, initially believed to be a meteor.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 1-2 minutes., The object was described as moving rapidly., Observers reported the shape of the object as cylindrical., The object emitted sparks and had a glowing red or orange color., The sighting was investigated by the Air Technical Intelligence Center, which concluded it was not an Unidentified Flying Object.
witness description: witnesses reported observing the object from a distance
